title: 114_s3245
content: The Act may be cited as the "Title VIII Nursing Workforce Reauthorization Act of 2016" and supports clinical nurse specialists. The "Title VIII Nursing Workforce Reauthorization Act of 2016" supports clinical nurse specialists by amending Section 811 of the Public Health Service Act to include authorized clinical nurse specialist programs that provide full-time education for registered nurses to effectively care for patients with acute and chronic illness. The "Title VIII Nursing Workforce Reauthorization Act of 2016" supports clinical nurse specialists by amending Section 811 of the Public Health Service Act to include authorized programs for nurses to provide care for patients with acute and chronic illness. Additionally, the Act defines a nurse-managed health clinic as a primary care service for underserved populations managed by advanced practice nurses. The National Advisory Council on Nurse Education and Practice is also amended to include clinical nurse specialists. Reauthorization of funding for nursing programs under Section 3. Amendments are made to various sections of the Public Health Service Act, including loan repayment programs, nurse faculty loan program, comprehensive geriatric education, and funding for specific parts. Additionally, changes are made to nurse education grants to include quality and retention. Section 831 of the Public Health Service Act is amended to promote career advancement for nursing personnel in various training settings and diverse population groups, including the advancement of individuals to become professional nurses, advanced education nurses, and registered nurses. The amendment to Section 831 of the Public Health Service Act aims to promote career advancement for nursing personnel by developing internships and residency programs in collaboration with accredited schools of nursing to encourage mentoring and specialization.
